articles.title: ISS astronauts take cover as defunct Russian satellite shatters - Al Jazeera English
articles.description: RESURS-P1 satellite splits into nearly 200 pieces, adding to the dangerous mass of debris already in orbit.
articles.content:
A defunct Russian satellite broke up into nearly 200 pieces of debris forcing astronauts on the International Space Station (ISS) to take shelter for about an hour.
